H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6424.def: literally: to make level (a road or path for someone else); hence: = causative action by which deities allow humans to make their journey to life without major obstacles

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H7358.def: = part of the lower body of women and mammals where offspring are conceived and in which they grow until their birth; ≈ sometimes extended to refer to a woman, the time of birth, the place where something is produced, and the innermost part of an area

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H3577.def: = state in which something that has been said is not truthful

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H1823.def: = state in which objects are, or are perceived as having something in common with other objects

H5175.def: = long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H6620.def: = snake with the ability to spread the ribs in the neck area, so as to form a broad, flat profile called the hood, which makes it look thicker than it really is; reaches two meters in length and 50 millimeters in diameter; it is dark brown with a yellowish underside; very poisonous; feeds on mice, gerbils, birds, bird eggs, lizards, frogs, and other snakes; ≈ associated with great danger

H2795.def: = state in which humans or animals are unable to perceive with the ears

H331.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = state of being covered by a structure or pattern consisting of strips crossing each other with square or diamond-shaped spaces left between

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3907.def: = action by which people talk softly among themselves to keep others from overhearing

H2449.def: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H2266.def: = state in which two or more inanimate objects are joined together

H2267.def: = state of being associated with other people for a common purpose

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2040.def: = state in which something is in extreme disrepair ◄ caused by either neglect or destruction

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4459.def: used in poetry only: = large, sharp {L:teeth<SDBH:שֵׁן>} of an animal; ≈ associated with aggression

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1869.def: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

H2671.def: = pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment

H4135.def: = action by which someone removes the foreskin of the penis, + preferably with a {L:flint<SDBH:צֹר>} knife, as a sign of the covenant between YHWH and Abraham's descendants; ≈ considered an outward change for the good that should be accompanied by an inward change in attitude as well

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H7642.def: = a land mollusk, usually with a spiral shell; a part of its body, called the foot, extends out of the shell and propels the snail; it excretes slime along the road which it travels

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H5309.def: = a baby who died in the womb

H1077.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H8121.def: = celestial body ► that marks day and night and produces warmth and light for the earth

H2962.def: = a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H329.def: = a tree that grows to 5 meters (17 feet), has small leaves forming an oval crown, and very sharp thorns; Lycaeum europaeum ({A:HALOT}, {A:DCH}, {A:NIDB} 1:496); or possibly a thorny bush of the Rubus genus, which includes several hundred species ({A:ABD} 2:80)

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H2740.def: = process by which objects become extremely dry ► and therefore highly inflammable

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H5359.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H7364.def: = causative action by which humans or animals wash (part of) their own body or someone else's body or another object, usually with water, ► in order to remove any dirt; ≈ the resulting cleanness often symbolizes ritual cleanness, innocence, or even holiness

H6471.def: = the lower part of the leg beyond the ankle, on which humans or animals stand and with which they walk

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
